page.title: 13Local Environment
page.content: Most of the local area is very rural. The largest concentration of people is in the village of Trewoon with smaller numbers of people in Lanjeth and High Street. There are about a dozen farms within the district but most of them are quite large and have many acres of fields between them. The other main feature of the local environment is the China Clay works. The area covered by pits, tips or driers is about one quarter of our total study area. Many people would consider that the China Clay industry is destroying the local countryside but most local people are quite proud of the industry and do not mind the 'White Mountains'. The effect on wildlife is difficult to ascertain because although the pits destroy the natural habitats, the disused tips and buildings provide many new ones and plants also flourish. (Mike Yates)
